column4: someone please help me cure this error : "Kernel :panic-not syncing:VFS:Unable to mount root fs on unknown-block[8,5]" . :(
hello, it seems your linux can not boot as it does not find its root partition
, exactly It can't and I have a hell lot of work stuck inside it :(
, This happened after I installed wireless driver into it
well, first, you need to run another linux on the machine, so burn a live linux cd if you do not have one and boot to it
, Can't I repair the existing one?
of course yes, the live distro is just to get booted, then you can mount existing partition and correct the mistake in grub configuration and all will be ok
, Do I need to reinstall ubuntu all over again?
also, probably try to start other grub entries (recovery lines, other kernels)
not
if your partion is okay (which is the most likely case) then your installation/data ... will be preserved, this is just a way how to get to the system and repair the configuration
good, then paste somewhere your menu.lst
more precisely /boot/grub/menu.lst
jsut to bude sure, what version of grub are you using? grub-legacy or grub2_
, Ah I will have to reboot to try this command.I have a dual boot system
Can you tell me the steps to make my new krnel working?
no problem, I am here, just quote me
wait

first, paste the menu.lst, then check if there is not any discrepancy like diferent root= ... if initramfs image is present ... then try dpkg-reconfigure <kernel-package-name> to check if there are no errors in this phase
then we can try something more
, DO you have any solution to panic kernel problem?
